entry.title: DFPA DEALING WITH ROUND TOP FIRE EAST OF ROSEBURG
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 4:10 a.m. Crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association are dealing with the Round Top Fire east of Roseburg. A DFPA post said the agency along with rural firefighters and landowner resources are engaged on an estimated 7 to 8-acre fire located near the 10000 block of North Umpqua Highway. The fire...

entry.title: MONDAY LIKELY HOTTEST DAY OF WEEK, COOLING TO COME
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 4:00 a.m. Monday will likely be the hottest day of the week in the Umpqua Valley, with some cooling coming as the week goes on. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg area will see highs in the mid-90s Monday....

entry.title: DRIVER CITED FOLLOWING TWO-VEHICLE CRASH ON FRIDAY
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 3:40 a.m. A driver was cited following a two-vehicle crash on Friday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said 11:40 a.m. the 71-year-old Roseburg was driving westbound in the 2300 block of North Bank Road northeast of Roseburg while a 48-year-old Sutherlin man was headed eastbound in a sedan. The first driver...

entry.title: HAPPY TRAILS DOG PARK TO REOPEN ONCE FENCING IS REPLACED
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 3:30 a.m. Happy Trails Dog Park will reopen this summer after fencing is replaced. A City of Roseburg release said a contractor is scheduled to start work in about two weeks to replace 730 feet of fencing that was mangled in the one-acre space next to Templin Beach Park, on Southeast Templin...

entry.title: MOVIES IN THE PARK RESCHEDULED
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg Parks and Recreation has announced a new show time for one of this summer’s “Movies in the Park” that got rained out in June. Disney’s “Moana2” has been rescheduled for Friday, August 15th. Rain canceled the show on Friday, June 20th. The PG-rated animated film will be shown at...

entry.title: SBA OPENS DISASTER LOAN OUTREACH CENTER IN ROSEBURG
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 3:05 a.m. The U.S. Small Business Administration has opened a Disaster Loan Outreach Center to help those impacted by flooding, landslides and mudslides that took place in March. It is open weekdays from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. in the Salmon Room on the top floor of the Roseburg Public Safety Center,...

entry.title: FREE SUMMER MEAL DISTRIBUTION CONTINUES IN SOUTH UMPQUA SCHOOLS
entry.summary: July 7, 2025 2:50 a.m. The South Umpqua School District is continuing its free meal distribution program throughout the south county area. Meals are available Mondays through Thursdays through August 14th at these locations and times: *Stagecoach Apartments in Canyonville from 10:45 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. *South Umpqua High School from 11:35 a.m. to 11:50...

entry.title: WINSTON POLICE CHARGE WOMAN WITH FIRST-DEGREE ARSON
entry.summary: July 6, 2025 6:00 p.m. Winston Police charged a woman with first-degree arson following a fire Friday evening. Sergeant Mike Miller said at about 7:40 p.m. officers were dispatched to a fire at the Blue Ridge Apartments on Southwest Hart Avenue. Miller said Following an investigation, officers learned that the resident, 33-year-old Melayna Good, had...

entry.title: Winston’s Fourth of July: A day jam-packed with fun
entry.summary: WINSTON — The Winston Area Independence Day (WAID) celebrations were non-stop Friday.

entry.title: Fires in Diamond Lake District
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — Crews with the Umpqua National Forest (UNF) are responding to new fire starts in the Diamond Lake District.

entry.title: Oakland’s Fourth of July parade keeps its hometown spirit
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Oakland’s Fourth of July parade has been around since it featured horses and buggies. The hometown charm of the event, however, hasn’t been lost, though the parade has traded in carriages for sports cars.

entry.title: MOTORCYCLIST EVADES DEPUTY EARLY FRIDAY
entry.summary: July 5, 2025 9:00 a.m. A motorcyclist evaded a deputy early Friday morning. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 2:00 a.m. a deputy attempted to conduct a traffic stop on a sport motorcycle on Interstate 5 northbound, a mile south of Rice Hill. The motorcycle accelerated and did not yield. The deputy continued...

entry.title: WINSTON POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING REPORTED HIT AND RUN INCIDENT
entry.summary: July 4, 2025 10:30 a.m. Winston Police jailed a man following a reported hit and run incident Wednesday night. Information from WPD said just after 8:20 p.m. officers received a report of a hit and run in the 100 block of Peach Street. During the investigation, officers learned that 29-year-old Cody Astry had allegedly used...

entry.title: SHERIFF HANLIN ISSUES STATEMENT REGARDING ARREST OF CORRECTIONS DEPUTY
entry.summary: July 4, 2025 6:30 a.m. Thursday evening, Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin issued a statement regarding the arrest of Corrections Deputy Jeremiah Heredia.
